item.title: `container_of` macro from the Linux
item.description: While working on my code, I came across the container_of macro, which I’ve seen before but never really delved into. Its implementation was mostly as I expected, but some details caught my interest. #define offsetof(TYPE, MEMBER) ((size_t) &((TYPE *)0)->MEMBER) /** * container_of - cast a member of a structure out to the containing structure * @ptr: the pointer to the member. * @type: the type of the container struct this is embedded in.
